possession.translation[0].definitions[0]: if something is in your possession, you own it, or you have obtained it from somewhere
How did the painting come into your possession  (=how did you get it)?
The finance company now has possession of the house.
We didn’t take possession of  (=get and start using) the car until a few days after the auction.
The house has been in the family’s possession since the 1500s.
That information is not in our possession.
She was found in possession of stolen goods.
possession.translation[0].definitions[1]: something that you own or have with you at a particular time
He had sold all his possessions and left the country.
I packed my remaining possessions into the trunk.
Prisoners were allowed no personal possessions.
This old violin had been her father’s most treasured possession.
possession.translation[0].definitions[2]: the crime of having illegal drugs or weapons with you or in your home
He was arrested and charged with possession of cocaine.
possession.translation[0].definitions[3]: when a person or team has control of the ball in some sports
possession.translation[0].definitions[4]: a country controlled or governed by another country
possession.translation[0].definitions[5]: a situation in which someone’s mind is being controlled by something evil
Was it a case of demonic possession?
possession.translation[0].note_box[0].he: – Meaning 1: if something is in your possession, you own it, or you have obtained it from somewhere
possession.translation[0].note_box[0].se: The painting has been in the family's possession since then.
You have a duty not to disclose confidential information that comes into your possession.
Before applying for a job, make sure you are in possession of the required qualifications.
My father had in his possession a letter written by Winston Churchill.
How did you come into possession of this document?
At 21, he was entitled to take possession of the property.
possession.translation[0].note_box[1].he: – Meaning 2: something that you own or have with you at a particular time
possession.translation[0].note_box[1].se: We were told that we could take only a few personal possessions with us.
Over his shoulder hung a bag which contained all his worldly possessions.
Many of them have lost all their material possessions as a result of the civil war.
A man was salvaging a few precious possessions from the rubble of a bombed house.
One of my most treasured possessions is a small book of prayers.
possession.translation[1].definitions[0]: It’s vital to insure your possessions for the journey to your new home.
possession.translation[1].definitions[1]: the state of having or owning something
What happens if the buyer has possession of a work, but has not completely paid for it when it is stolen?
The creditors will take possession of assets worth the $85 million owed to them.
The company refused to relinquish possession of the 68-bed hospital.
possession.translation[1].definitions[2]: the crime of having illegal drugs or a gun when it is illegal to do so
He was sentenced to 16 months in prison for cocaine possession.
